item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Source: Eli Manning, New York Giants agree to six-year, $97.5 million contract extension
item.description: Eli Manning has agreed to a new six-year, $97 million contract extension with the New York Giants that will make him the highest paid player in the NFL with an average salary of roughly $15.3 million.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Fielder gets hit, goes after Dodgers postgame
item.description: Prince Fielder was hit by a pitch in the Brewers' blowout loss to the Dodgers and then tried to get in the L.A. clubhouse after the game.

item.dc:creator: Kelly Naqi
item.title: Donte' Stallworth of Cleveland Browns to meet with Roger Goodell, source says
item.description: Browns wide receiver Donte' Stallworth, currently under indefinite suspension by the NFL, will meet with commissioner Roger Goodell on Wednesday afternoon in Manhattan, according to a source with knowledge of the meeting.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Hank Aaron wants 2003 list of failed tests revealed
item.description: Hank Aaron wants the names on the 2003 list of players who flunked drug tests to be released and thinks Pete Rose should be reinstated.

item.dc:creator: James Walker
item.title: Braylon Edwards, of Cleveland Browns, practices for first time
item.description: Cleveland Browns receiver Braylon Edwards practiced for the first time in training camp Wednesday after the team took him off the Non-Football Injury List.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Plaxico Burress case: Antonio Pierce of New York Giants has no regrets about helping ex-teammate
item.description: Giants linebacker Antonio Pierce says he has no regrets about his actions in helping Plaxico Burress after his former teammate accidentally shot himself in the leg last November.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Pujols' 5th slam sends Cards past Mets in 10th
item.description: Albert Pujols hit a grand slam in the 10th inning for his second homer of the game and the St. Louis Cardinals rallied to beat the New York Mets 12-7 on Tuesday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Green Bay Packers GM Ted Thompson won't rule out interest in Michael Vick
item.description: Packers general manager Ted Thompson isn't ruling out potential interest in Michael Vick.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Brandon Roy, Portland Trail Blazers close to long-term contract
item.description: Brandon Roy and the Blazers are reportedly nearing agreement on a long-term extension.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Man charged with murder in death of Vernon Forrest
item.description: A 20-year-old Atlanta man was charged Tuesday with murder in the shooting death of ex-boxing champion Vernon Forrest.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Cleveland Cavaliers play Boston Celtics, and Los Angeles Lakers get their rings on NBA opening night
item.description: In a replay of last year's opener, the Cleveland Cavaliers and Boston Celtics will launch the 2009-10 NBA season -- only this time LeBron James has some welcome firepower in new teammate Shaquille O'Neal.
